poemContent: From last summer's autumn tears,î€to present summer smiles, thisî€pen has travelled a million miles,î€Dragging it's ball across the page,î€writing poems and jokes, and stuff soî€gay.î€î€I feel sorry for it's suffering I have incurred,î€luckily the pen's screams can not be heard î€€î€„î€€ğŸ˜.î€î€î€‚And as I write now, I grin as I sit,î€goodbye pen, you're being replaced.î€î€‚î€
